title: Unauthorized Access Attempt on VPN Gateway
description: Multiple failed login attempts followed by a successful connection from an unusual geographic location on the main VPN gateway.
initial_findings: Credential stuffing or brute force attack successful against VPN.

title: Malicious Document Delivered via Email
description: User reported suspicious attachment in a phishing email. Analysis indicates embedded malicious macro attempting to download payload.
initial_findings: Potential client-side exploitation via malicious document.

title: Web Application SQL Injection Attempt
description: Web application firewall blocked multiple requests containing suspected SQL injection payloads targeting the login page.
initial_findings: Attempted SQL injection against internal web app.

title: Lateral Movement Detected via PsExec
description: Security monitoring alerted on PsExec usage originating from a compromised workstation to a critical server.
initial_findings: Lateral movement attempt from workstation to file server.

title: Suspicious Activity on Database Server
description: Unusual queries and large data transfers observed from the database server to an external IP.
initial_findings: Potential data exfiltration from database server.

title: Web Server Compromise via CMS Vulnerability
description: Alerts indicate successful exploitation of a known vulnerability in the installed CMS on a public-facing web server.
initial_findings: Web server compromised via CMS vulnerability, web shell uploaded.

title: Privilege Escalation Detected
description: Security agent alerted on unusual process behavior indicating a potential privilege escalation attempt on a Windows server.
initial_findings: Attempted privilege escalation on application server.

title: Suspicious Network Scan Activity
description: Internal network monitoring detected widespread scanning activity originating from a user workstation.
initial_findings: Internal network reconnaissance from a workstation.

title: Compromised Cloud Instance
description: Cloud provider alert indicates unusual activity and resource usage on a specific EC2 instance, potentially compromised.
initial_findings: Cloud instance potentially compromised, used for resource hijacking.

title: Supply Chain Compromise Alert (Simulated)
description: Threat intelligence feed indicates a potential compromise in a widely used open-source library present in our applications.
initial_findings: Risk assessment needed for applications using potentially compromised library version.

title: DDoS Attack Initiated
description: High volume of traffic detected targeting the main corporate website, indicative of a Distributed Denial of Service attack.
initial_findings: DDoS attack in progress targeting public website.

title: Insider Threat Activity Detected
description: User with standard privileges accessed and copied sensitive files from a restricted network share.
initial_findings: Potential insider data theft.

title: Malicious PowerShell Activity
description: Security monitoring detected obfuscated PowerShell script execution with unusual network connections.
initial_findings: Execution of potentially malicious PowerShell script.

title: Container Escape Attempt
description: Security alerts triggered within a Kubernetes cluster indicating a container attempting to break out of its isolation.

observed_ttps.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanisms: Bypass User Account Control

initial_findings: Attempted container escape on a Kubernetes worker node.

title: Exploitation of Public-Facing API
description: Logs show unusual requests and responses from a public-facing API endpoint, suggesting exploitation.
initial_findings: Potential exploitation of public API via injection or authentication bypass.

title: Suspicious RDP Activity
description: Multiple failed RDP login attempts followed by a successful login from an external IP to a server that should not be publicly accessible.
initial_findings: Unauthorized external RDP access to internal jump server.

title: Malicious File Downloaded
description: Endpoint detection alerted on a user downloading a file with a known malicious hash from a suspicious website.
initial_findings: User downloaded known malware.

title: Code Injection Vulnerability Exploited
description: Security logs show unusual commands being executed within the context of a web application process.
initial_findings: Code injection vulnerability exploited in web application.

title: Authentication Bypass on Admin Panel
description: Logs indicate successful access to an administrative panel without proper authentication.
initial_findings: Authentication bypass vulnerability likely exploited on admin panel.

title: Deserialization Vulnerability Exploited
description: Application logs show errors and unusual behavior consistent with a deserialization attack.
initial_findings: Deserialization vulnerability exploited on Java application server.

title: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
description: Web application logs show attempts to include external entities via XML input.

observed_ttps.name: Gather Victim Host Information: File Contents

initial_findings: Attempted XXE injection against internal service.

title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Detected
description: Security monitoring alerted on suspicious script execution in a user's browser originating from our web application.
initial_findings: Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in web application exploited.

title: Insecure Deserialization in .NET Application
description: Application logs show errors related to type mismatches during deserialization, potentially indicating an attack.
initial_findings: Insecure deserialization vulnerability likely exploited in .NET application.

title: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Attempt
description: Web application firewall blocked requests attempting to access internal resources via a public-facing endpoint.
initial_findings: Attempted SSRF against image processing service.

title: LDAP Injection Attempt
description: Authentication service logs show unusual queries with special characters, consistent with an LDAP injection attempt.
initial_findings: Attempted LDAP injection against authentication service.

title: Remote Code Execution via Unrestricted File Upload
description: Web application allowed upload of a file with a suspicious extension, followed by attempts to execute it.
initial_findings: Remote code execution via unrestricted file upload vulnerability.

title: SSRF to Access Cloud Metadata
description: Logs show attempts to leverage a public-facing service to access cloud instance metadata.

observed_ttps.name: Gather Victim Host Information: File Contents

initial_findings: Attempted SSRF to access cloud metadata service.

title: Buffer Overflow Attempt
description: Application crashed with errors indicating a potential buffer overflow condition triggered by malformed input.
initial_findings: Buffer overflow vulnerability likely attempted, causing denial of service.

title: Use After Free Vulnerability Exploited
description: Security monitoring detected unusual memory access patterns and application instability consistent with a use-after-free exploit.
initial_findings: Use-after-free vulnerability potentially exploited in media processing service.

title: Integer Overflow Vulnerability Attempt
description: Application logs show unexpected behavior and calculations resulting from large input values, indicative of an integer overflow attempt.
initial_findings: Integer overflow vulnerability likely attempted.

title: Race Condition Vulnerability Exploited
description: Logs show a sequence of events occurring in an unexpected order, leading to unauthorized state change, consistent with a race condition exploit.

indicators_of_compromise.value: operations completed out of expected order

initial_findings: Race condition vulnerability potentially exploited in transaction service.

title: Format String Vulnerability Attempt
description: Application logs show errors and unusual output when processing input containing format string specifiers.
initial_findings: Format string vulnerability likely attempted.

title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Attempt
description: Web application logs show requests originating from unexpected sources with valid user sessions, consistent with a CSRF attempt.
initial_findings: CSRF vulnerability likely attempted against user portal.

title: SQL Injection via Second-Order Injection
description: Application logs show unusual database errors triggered by data previously submitted by a user, indicating second-order SQL injection.
initial_findings: Second-order SQL injection vulnerability potentially exploited.

title: Server-Side Template Injection Attempt
description: Web application logs show attempts to inject template syntax into user-controlled input fields.
initial_findings: Server-Side Template Injection vulnerability likely attempted.

title: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) Detected
description: User accessed data belonging to another user by changing an ID parameter in a URL.

observed_ttps.name: CLIENT-SIDE ATTACK: Insecure Direct Object Reference

indicators_of_compromise.value: user accessed data for different user ID

initial_findings: IDOR vulnerability detected in user data API.

title: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Misconfiguration
description: Browser security alerts indicate a web application is allowing cross-origin requests from unexpected domains.

indicators_of_compromise.value: CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present

initial_findings: CORS misconfiguration on public web application.

title: Subdomain Takeover Attempt
description: Threat intelligence alert indicates a dangling DNS record pointing to a service that is no longer active, potentially allowing subdomain takeover.
initial_findings: Potential subdomain takeover risk due to dangling DNS record.

title: Open Redirect Vulnerability Exploited
description: Security logs show users being redirected to external, potentially malicious websites via a trusted internal URL.

indicators_of_compromise.value: clicked link leading to external site

initial_findings: Open redirect vulnerability exploited in URL shortener service.
